comments:
Marketing 235 focuses on marketing management's use of advertising as a promotional variable. The course will concentrate on concepts and theories of advertising as they apply to the strategic decisions of an advertising or brand manager. Emphasis will be placed on product positioning, the communication process, and the measurement and evaluation of advertising effects.

Students provided no negative comments about the subject matter itself, but several students indicated that the class would have been improved to some degree if the professor had made better use of digital resources, such as PowerPoint, and had been less disorganized. A few students noted that readings could have been slightly more relevant to in-class material. One student affirmed, “Overall, one of the best courses I have taken at Penn,” and another cited the interactive nature of the classroom experience as a strong positive.

Students raved about Professor Adams’ teaching ability and personality. According to one student, he was “sociable, engaging, funny, and wants students to enjoy the course material.” Another noted, “He’s a great educator and truly has a passion for advertising, teaching, and helping his students succeed.”
